intro: Delissea kuhihewa, commonly known as the Kona false hibiscus, is a flowering plant native to the Hawaiian Islands. It belongs to the Malvaceae family and is characterized by its showy, five-petaled flowers that range in color from white to pink. The plant typically grows in coastal areas and has adapted to the humid, tropical climate of Hawaii. Its leaves are heart-shaped and covered in fine hairs, while its stems are woody and often branching. Delissea kuhihewa plays an important role in the local ecosystem and is a symbol of Hawaiian cultural heritage.
